org.asl.socketserver

Class GameTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.asl.socketserver.GameTracker

  • public class GameTracker
extends java.lang.Object
    Locates servable classes within the project directory structure. Maintains a list of servables, along with information collected from MenuInfo annotations and associated high scores for each class.
    Version:
    Fall, 2017
    Author:
    K. Collins

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      GameTracker()

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameTracker

        public GameTracker()

    • Method Detail

      • buildGameListMenu

        public static java.lang.String buildGameListMenu()
        Prepares a game menu string displaying the game index, game name, current high score, and high score holder's initials. For nostalgia, the fixed width of the output is set to 80 characters, the original number of columns on early punch cards.
        Returns:
        a menu string displaying information on available games

      • checkValidInteger

        public static boolean checkValidInteger(java.lang.String s)
        Checks that a submitted string can be safely converted to an integer.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to be tested
        Returns:
        true if s can be parsed to integer; false, otherwise

      • handleUserSelection

        public static java.lang.Object handleUserSelection(java.lang.String userSelection)
        Examines user selection and returns either a String holding a menu, a new instance of the requested game, or null if neither of the above makes sense.
        Parameters:
        userSelection - string representing the user's choice
        Returns:
        an object representing a menu string, a game instance or null

      • findServableClasses

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends Servable>> findServableClasses()
                                                                               throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Collects from the working directory all files that implement the Servable interface
        Returns:
        a list holding all classes that implement Servable
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the requested class is not found

      • initialize

        public static void initialize()
        Initializes the game database. Should be called on the class when starting the application. The GameServer class does this when starting the service.

      • formatGameInfoString

        public static java.lang.String formatGameInfoString(MenuInfo mi)
        Takes the information in a MenuInfo annotation and prepares it for display.
        Parameters:
        mi - a MenuInfo reference
        Returns:
        a string appropriate for text display of game information

      • getGameInfo

        public static java.lang.String getGameInfo(java.lang.Class<Servable> c)
        Retrieves the GameInfo object associated with this class. The returned object is drawn from the game data map collected when the server was initialized.
        Parameters:
        c - the class on which to search for game information
        Returns:
        the GameInfo object loaded for the indicated class

      • getBestScore

        public static BestScore getBestScore(java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractGame> someClass)
        For the indicated game, get the current best score.
        Parameters:
        someClass - a class reference
        Returns:
        the current best score; null, if not found

      • setBestScore

        public static void setBestScore(java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractGame> someClass,
                                BestScore record)
        Associates a BestScore with the indicated game class. Refreshes the game menu so that it will display the modified best score.
        Parameters:
        someClass - the class for which a new high score has been achieved
        record - a record indicating the best score and initials of who set
